name: Cosmic Microwave Background
explanation: CMB is remnant radiation from Big Bang, now cooled to 2.725 K. Peak wavelength ~1 mm (microwave). Provides snapshot of universe at 380,000 years old. Tiny temperature fluctuations (1 part in 100,000) reveal density variations that grew into galaxies. Strongest evidence for Big Bang theory.

examples.solution: Direct evidence of Big Bang and seed of all structure
steps: Oldest light in universe (380,000 years after Big Bang)
Shows universe was hot, dense, uniform
These grew via gravity into galaxies and clusters
